summary_points: 1. On August 13, 2025, TransDigm Group priced $5 billion of new debt, exceeding the initially announced $4 billion, to fund a special cash dividend of approximately $5 billion and related expenses.
2. TransDigm Group expects to incur up to $2.5 billion in new term loans maturing in August 2032, concurrently with the debt offerings.

3.  The offering of $2.5 billion in senior notes is expected to close on August 19, 2025, subject to customary closing conditions; the closing of the Secured Notes is independent of the Subordinated Notes, and vice versa.
1. On August 13, 2025, Louisville Gas and Electric Company issued $700,000,000 of 5.850% First Mortgage Bonds due 2055, and Kentucky Utilities Company issued $700,000,000 of similar bonds.

2.  Louisville Gas and Electric Company intends to use the net proceeds from its bond sale to repay $300 million in debt due October 1, 2025, while Kentucky Utilities Company will use its proceeds to repay $250 million in debt due on the same date.
3.  Both bond issuances are subject to early redemption.
1. On August 13, 2025, Chevron U.S.A. Inc. issued $4,900,000,000 in notes, guaranteed by Chevron Corporation, comprised of various fixed and floating rate notes maturing between 2027 and 2035.
2.  The issuance of these notes resulted in approximately $4,900,000,000 in net proceeds (before expenses) for Chevron U.S.A. Inc.
3.  The  fixed rate notes are redeemable by Chevron U.S.A. Inc. prior to maturity at a make-whole call price, while the floating rate notes are not redeemable prior to maturity.

1. Solventum Corp. (formerly 3M Health Care Co.) announced the closing of a transaction with Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. on August 13, 2025, for the sale of its purification and filtration business (excluding the drinking water filtration business) at a reduced price of approximately $4.0 billion from the initial agreement's $4.1 billion.
2.  The pro forma balance sheet as of June 30, 2025, shows a significant increase in cash and cash equivalents to approximately $4.382 billion, compared to $492 million pre-transaction.

3.  Due to jurisdictional restrictions, the transfer of assets and employees in certain jurisdictions will be delayed; this will leave approximately $98 million in non-current assets held for sale after the transaction closes, resulting in a corresponding current liability.
1. Cisco's Q4 2025 revenue was $14.7 billion, an 8% year-over-year increase, exceeding the high end of its guidance range.
2.  AI infrastructure orders from webscale customers exceeded $800 million in Q4 2025, bringing the fiscal year total to over $2 billion, more than double the initial target of $1 billion.
3. Cisco projects Q1 FY2026 revenue to be between $14.65 billion and $14.85 billion, and FY2026 revenue to be between $59.0 billion and $60.0 billion.
1. Cisco's Q4 2025 revenue was $14.7 billion, an 8% year-over-year increase, exceeding the high end of its guidance range.
2.  AI infrastructure orders from webscale customers exceeded $800 million in Q4 2025, bringing the fiscal year total to over $2 billion, more than double the initial target of $1 billion.
3. Cisco projects Q1 FY2026 revenue to be between $14.65 billion and $14.85 billion, and FY2026 revenue to be between $59.0 billion and $60.0 billion.
1. In March 2025, Nucor issued $1 billion in notes (4.650% due 2030 and 5.100% due 2035), receiving net proceeds of $997 million after capitalizing and amortizing $9 million in issuance costs.
2. Nucor amended its revolving credit facility in March 2025, increasing borrowing capacity from $1.75 billion to $2.25 billion and extending maturity to March 11, 2030.
3.  The net proceeds from the March 2025 note issuance were used to redeem $1 billion in outstanding 2.000% and 3.950% notes due 2025.
1. Domino's Pizza Inc. subsidiaries issued $1 billion in senior secured notes on August 12, 2025, with maturities of 5 and 7 years.
2. The notes were sold in an offering exempt from registration, with the closing anticipated for September 5, 2025.
3.  The filing includes numerous representations and warranties from Domino's, covering aspects of its financial health, legal compliance, and business operations as of August 12, 2025.
1. Wynn Macau issued $1 billion in senior notes on August 19th, 2025, receiving net proceeds of $989 million.
2. The offering was slightly undersubscribed, resulting in an $11 million shortfall.
3. A change of control provision exists; if Wynn Resorts' ownership in Wynn Resorts (Macau) falls below 60%, noteholders can demand repurchase.
1. Fiserv Inc. entered into a new $8 billion senior unsecured revolving credit facility maturing August 12, 2030, replacing a prior $6 billion facility.
2.  The new credit facility increases the maximum aggregate principal amount available by $2 billion compared to the previous agreement.

3.  The new credit agreement includes covenants restricting consolidated indebtedness to no more than 3.75 times consolidated EBITDA, triggering immediate repayment if breached or in the event of bankruptcy proceedings.
1. Lindsey Caplan, CBRE Group, Inc.'s Chief Accounting Officer, will resign on August 31, 2025, and leave the company entirely on December 31, 2025.
2. Andrew Horn, the company's Deputy Chief Financial Officer, will become the principal accounting officer on September 1, 2025.
3. There are no special arrangements or family relationships involved in Andrew Horn's appointment as principal accounting officer.
